title: After witnessing Biden's campaign, do you think Bernie Sanders would have been a stronger choice? - Quora

response.answer_text: Biden has run a pretty by-the-book and competent campaign. He hasn’t made any glaring errors. He is still leading the polls and his lead has been stable and steady for a long time. I don’t think he’s run a bad campaign at all. So, no, I don’t think Sanders would have been a stronger choice. Sanders had a lot of negatives against him: health issues (people bring up Biden’s mental health “issues”, but conveniently forget that Sanders had a heart attack during the campaign), appearance of being too extreme, lack of Black voter support that he never tried to fix, unenthusiastic Democratic Party support, a voter base that doesn’t vote (college kids, Latinx, etc.), past comments about communism, aggressive personality, sloppy campaigning, lack of enthusiasm among female voters, to name a few. Sanders wouldn’t have been able to build a coalition of voters to counter Trump’s enthusiastic and motivated base. A lot of on the fence moderates would be turned off by some of Sanders’ policies and wouldn’t stomach voting for him. They might have either stayed home or hold their nose and vote for Trump. Biden is at least a tolerable alternative to moderates and even some Republicans. Never Trump Republicans might vote for Biden and they could be the difference in this election for a Trump defeat. Could you see them vote for Sanders who stands for pretty much everything they are against? I doubt it.

Bernie doesn't have dementia. So that would be something positive. What most people don’t know is that Bernie did not want to be President. He ran in the primary at the request of the Democrat leadership. They asked for this, so they could make it appear that Hilary “won” the primary. Bernie then did it again for the Democrats, so that Biden could appear to have “won” the primary. Bernie campaigns a bit, then, on-que, endorses the “winner”. He brings on board his followers (the Democrat leadership needs them). Why did Bernie do this? He did it to make money. The Democrats helped Bernie to set up a media company, in his wife’s name. Bernie then laundered his campaign “contributions” (Some of these from Democrats) through his wife’s media company. The media company keeps 15% off the top. This is above the costs and expenses. This scam is allowed by law (politicians wrote this law). The media company and the campaign can use the rest of the money to cover all other expenses, for both the media company and the campaign. It is estimated that Bernie netted up to $15 million personally, in his families pocket, for each of these runs. That is a lot of money. Bernie, who has never had a real job, “needed” the money for his retirement. So Bernie is like Biden in that he is very corrupt. No use asking your question because Bernie in no way wanted to be President. The Dems wouldn’t let him anyway. Bernie, like Biden, was after money.

Of all the dozen or so candidates who vied for the presidential chair, the two most honest ones were Bernie Sanders and Tulsi Gabbard. While most of us don’t agree with Bernie Sanders’ socialistic position, there is no question that he tells the truth as he knows it. You can’t say that for other wishful candidates, including Joe Biden and Kamala Harris. To repeat, the two most honest were Bernie Sanders and Tulsi Gabbard. To revisit your question: “After witnessing Biden's campaign, do you think Bernie Sanders would have been a stronger choice?” Yes, I do, but he didn’t resonate with moderate Democrats. However, with Biden/Harris, I believe the moderate Democrats are in for a real surprise when they finally realize just how far left the Democrat Party and Biden/Harris have become. At least, as I said, the moderate ones will, of which there aren’t many moderates left in Washington, D.C. The radical left has taken over the party.

Anyone one witnessing Biden‘s campaign knows that Biden is doing a wonderful job of campaigning. The evidence of that is reflected in the public opinion polls that show him beating Donald Trump handily throughout the country and in the key battleground states. Bernie Sanders ran a very poor campaign in the primaries. The evidence of that is he lost to Biden by a wide margin. That means Joe Biden is a much stronger choice than Bernie Sanders. Just count the votes. They tell the whole story.

Bernie Sanders had genuine enthusiasm to his campaign. Conversely, Biden has no energy, as evidenced that he needed Obama’s help to drag him over the finish line just to get the nomination. Biden’s campaign is bereft of ideas, with his campaign’s theme seemingly ‘I’m not Trump’, while Bernie had, like them or not, genuine ideas. Bernie used to be personable. Today, he’s a nothing on the stump… when he’s actually out of his basement. And he’s back to Irritable Joe no that his involvement with his son’s ‘business’ activities in Ukraine, China and Russia is increasingly evident.

Campaign is over. The voters already decided who they wanted to run against Trump. It wasn’t Bernie Sanders. He does have progressive policies but the voters weren’t ready. He wasn’t able to get people to vote for him they wanted someone more Centrist. Bernie’s heart attack was also an issue. His subordinates was also problematic he can’t control them. I think how Bernie behaved with his loss in 2016 is what also turned off voters.

I have no doubt Bernie would have been a stronger and a better choice, but he would have been a much better and a much stronger choice in 2016. We would have avoided the last four years of complete incompetency altogether had he been the nominee four years ago. There would not have been a President Trump. Not ever.
No, Sanders more target area for Trump that may have been more credible, particularly the socialist and far left, narrative as well as anti semitism for his white supremists supporters.

Yes! People with severe TDS with a conscience would happily vote for Bernie rather than Biden. That comprises about 20% of America, so it still wouldn’t made any difference. Trump will win either way!
Original Question: After witnessing Biden's campaign, do you think Bernie Sanders would have been a stronger choice? Answer: YES!
